intro: Vexillabium nakaianum, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens. Vexillabium nakaianum is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
